overview: Nicolas Hulot and the Ushuaïa Nature team set out to meet the people of the Mekong, from the province of Kamouane in Laos to the lost city of Angkor, the Khmer Versailles in Cambodia. The unconquered waters of the Mekong, a mythical river, 4200 km long, have conditioned the flourishing of the most intriguing civilizations of Southeast Asia. This incredible journey in the Indochinese peninsula is an opportunity to recall that all life in the hands of nature ...
title: Ushuaia Nature - La cité perdue
